verses.verse: Who is as the <S%H2450>wise<s%> man? and who <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> the <S%H6592>interpretation<s%> of a <S%H1697>thing<s%>? a <S%H120>man's<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> maketh his <S%H6440>face<s%> to <S%H215>shine<s%>, and the <S%H5797>boldness<s%> of his <S%H6440>face<s%> shall be <S%H8132>changed<s%>. the boldness: Heb. the strength
I counsel thee to <S%H8104>keep<s%> the <S%H4428>king's<s%> <S%H6310>commandment<s%>, and that in <S%H1700>regard<s%> of the <S%H7621>oath<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%>.

Be not <S%H926>hasty<s%> to go <S%H3212>out<s%> of his <S%H6440>sight<s%>: <S%H5975>stand<s%> not in an <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H1697>thing<s%>; for he <S%H6213>doeth<s%> whatsoever <S%H2654>pleaseth<s%> him.
Where the <S%H1697>word<s%> of a <S%H4428>king<s%> is, there is <S%H7983>power<s%>: and who may <S%H559>say<s%> unto him, What <S%H6213>doest<s%> thou?

Whoso <S%H8104>keepeth<s%> the <S%H4687>commandment<s%> shall <S%H3045>feel<s%> no <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H1697>thing<s%>: and a wise <S%H2450>man's<s%> <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H3045>discerneth<s%> both <S%H6256>time<s%> and <S%H4941>judgment<s%>. shall: Heb. shall know
Because to every <S%H2656>purpose<s%> there <S%H3426>is<s%> <S%H6256>time<s%> and <S%H4941>judgment<s%>, therefore the <S%H7451>misery<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> is <S%H7227>great<s%> upon him.
For he <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> not that which shall be: for who can <S%H5046>tell<s%> him when it shall be? when: or, how it shall be?

There is no <S%H120>man<s%> that hath <S%H7989>power<s%> over the <S%H7307>spirit<s%> to <S%H3607>retain<s%> the <S%H7307>spirit<s%>; neither hath he <S%H7983>power<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H4194>death<s%>: and there is no <S%H4917>discharge<s%> in that <S%H4421>war<s%>; neither shall <S%H7562>wickedness<s%> <S%H4422>deliver<s%> those that are <S%H1167>given<s%> to it. discharge: or, casting off weapons

All this have I <S%H7200>seen<s%>, and <S%H5414>applied<s%> my <S%H3820>heart<s%> unto every <S%H4639>work<s%> that is <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>: there is a <S%H6256>time<s%> wherein one <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H7980>ruleth<s%> over another to his own <S%H7451>hurt<s%>.

And <S%H3651>so<s%> I <S%H7200>saw<s%> the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H6912>buried<s%>, who had <S%H935>come<s%> and <S%H1980>gone<s%> from the <S%H4725>place<s%> of the <S%H6918>holy<s%>, and they were <S%H7911>forgotten<s%> in the <S%H5892>city<s%> where they had so <S%H6213>done<s%>: this is also <S%H1892>vanity<s%>.

Because <S%H6599>sentence<s%> against an <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H4639>work<s%> is not <S%H6213>executed<s%> <S%H4120>speedily<s%>, therefore the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%> is fully <S%H4390>set<s%> in them to <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%>.

Though a <S%H2398>sinner<s%> <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> an hundred <S%H3967>times<s%>, and his days be <S%H748>prolonged<s%>, yet surely I <S%H3045>know<s%> that it shall be <S%H2896>well<s%> with them that <S%H3373>fear<s%> <S%H430>God<s%>, which <S%H3372>fear<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> him:

But it shall not be <S%H2896>well<s%> with the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>, neither shall he <S%H748>prolong<s%> his <S%H3117>days<s%>, which are as a <S%H6738>shadow<s%>; because he <S%H3373>feareth<s%> not <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H430>God<s%>.

There <S%H3426>is<s%> a <S%H1892>vanity<s%> which is <S%H6213>done<s%> upon the <S%H776>earth<s%>; that there be <S%H6662>just<s%> men, unto whom it <S%H5060>happeneth<s%> according to the <S%H4639>work<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>; again, there <S%H3426>be<s%> <S%H7563>wicked<s%> men, to whom it <S%H5060>happeneth<s%> according to the <S%H4639>work<s%> of the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>: I <S%H559>said<s%> that this <S%H1571>also<s%> is <S%H1892>vanity<s%>.

Then I <S%H7623>commended<s%> <S%H8057>mirth<s%>, because a <S%H120>man<s%> hath no better <S%H2896>thing<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>, than to <S%H398>eat<s%>, and to <S%H8354>drink<s%>, and to be <S%H8055>merry<s%>: for that shall <S%H3867>abide<s%> with him of his <S%H5999>labour<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H2416>life<s%>, which <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> him under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>.

When I <S%H5414>applied<s%> mine <S%H3820>heart<s%> to <S%H3045>know<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>, and to <S%H7200>see<s%> the <S%H6045>business<s%> that is <S%H6213>done<s%> upon the <S%H776>earth<s%>: (for also there is that neither <S%H3117>day<s%> nor <S%H3915>night<s%> <S%H7200>seeth<s%> <S%H8142>sleep<s%> with his <S%H5869>eyes<s%>:)

Then I <S%H7200>beheld<s%> all the <S%H4639>work<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%>, that a <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H3201>cannot<s%> find <S%H4672>out<s%> the <S%H4639>work<s%> that is <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>: <S%H834>because<s%> <S%H7945>though<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H5998>labour<s%> to seek it <S%H1245>out<s%>, yet he shall not <S%H4672>find<s%> it; yea further; though a <S%H2450>wise<s%> man <S%H559>think<s%> to <S%H3045>know<s%> it, yet shall he not be <S%H3201>able<s%> to <S%H4672>find<s%> it.
